intro: Mosla hangchouensis, commonly known as Chinese bugloss, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Mosla hangchouensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
